intro: Stenogyne parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered stenogyne, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas. The plant has small, tubular flowers that are usually pale green to white in color, and it produces small, elliptical berries. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Stenogyne parviflora is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across the Hawaiian archipelago.
